meta.name: google-site-verification
description
meta.content: The mission of District 157-C is to prepare all students to be confident, life-long learners and productive citizens by challenging them to reach their fullest potential and by providing a quality educational environment in partnership with family and community.

h1.strong: Extended School Closure Lesson Plans due to COVID-19

h3.big: Frankfort School District 157-C in collaboration with the Frankfort Teacher’s Association is proud to offer our students a remote learning plan that will continue to engage every child during this temporary school closure. A weekly lesson plan will be posted by 8am every Monday for the remainder of the closure. Please contact your child’s teacher via their school email with questions or clarification in regards to all opportunities that are posted.

big.strong: To access the remote learning plans due to COVID-19 school closure please CLICK HERE.

div.h1: Please join us each day in saying the Pledge of Allegiance

p.span: The mission of District 157-C is to prepare all students to be confident, life-long learners and productive citizens by challenging them to reach their fullest potential and by providing a quality educational environment in partnership with family and community.

h3.strong:
The District Office will have staff available between the hours of 7:30 am and 9:30 am during the week for assistance.
Per Governor Pritzker’s ‘Stay-at- Home’ directive, all District schools and property, including parking lots, playgrounds and tracks are closed to the public until further notice. Only essential employees and approved visitors will be allowed on District property. Thank you for your cooperation.

div.p: If you have misplaced your username or password please send an Email to aatechhelp@fsd157c.org.
With the launch of our Virtual Backpack, District 157-C is introducing an eco-friendly online distribution system that saves resources and time required to sort and handle materials.
Click here to view District 157-C's Facebook page
Click here to view School Board meeting information
Registration for existing students may be completed online. New student registration must be completed in person.
Save time and stamps by making payments online. Powered by RevTrak.
Click here to view our Facility Rental packet
Download the Request For Review of Transportation Assignment Form
In the event of an emergency school closing the following procedure will take place.
Polling places to be moved out of District 157-C schools - Click to Read More
The Education Foundation was developed to enrich the education of our school children by enhancing and supplementing the programs and resources currently offered by the District.
The mission of the FSP is to bring families into the school experience through volunteer opportunities and family fun events.

As a result of the 21st Century Continuous Learning Plan, the District is experiencing a positive trajectory of student achievement outcomes as measured by local, state and national assessments in the core academic areas of instruction.

The District offers student insurance through Markel Insurance Company. This insurance is offered as an additional/supplemental benefit for our families, but is not required by the School District or associated with the School District.
Read about our procedures for visitors and volunteers arriving at District 157-C Schools.
